storyInfo: The Doctor, Kal'tsit, and Amiya give it their all as they stand against Priestess.

attributes.content: We've traveled far enough, and I fear there's no longer a point in continuing our exploration.
attributes.name: Oracle

attributes.content: Ten thousand day cycles have passed since I entered hibernation, but Terra's changes have been limited.
attributes.name: Oracle

attributes.content: The spark of life from Talos-II is still weak. The other seeds of hope planted by my former companions have shown no signs of sprouting either.
attributes.name: Oracle

attributes.content: (Expressing dismay)
attributes.name: AMa-10

attributes.content: Are you disappointed? No... I have expected this result long ago, actually.
attributes.name: Oracle

attributes.content: I miscalculated the pace at which everything would develop. It's not the right time, and there's only so much I can do.
attributes.name: Oracle

attributes.content: Time... I just need more time.
attributes.name: Oracle

attributes.content: I can't continue wasting the life of this body. I have to return to sleep inside the sarcophagus, and wait for an opportunity more ripe than this.
attributes.name: Oracle

attributes.content: ...I have to admit, I broke my promise, and this is a sort of betrayal.
attributes.name: Oracle

attributes.content: But it is because I still love life that I must have hope. There is no other way.
attributes.name: Oracle

attributes.content: Though I fear she's already anticipated my early awakening.
attributes.name: Oracle

attributes.content: Inside that sarcophagus, I discovered a lynchpin-modifying program.
attributes.name: Oracle

attributes.content: (Expressing confusion)
attributes.name: AMa-10

attributes.content: Technology born in a lost age, used to strengthen our thoughts and conviction. Without it, many would lose the will needed to make it through that period of endless despair.
attributes.name: Oracle

attributes.content: She and I, we went through it together...
attributes.name: Oracle

attributes.content: She knows and understands me best, of course, but it is also why our differing opinions are my deepest regret.
attributes.name: Oracle

attributes.content: She anticipated my actions, and the hidden program within the sarcophagus activated when I woke up. It can modify my cognition, and the purpose of our 'debates'...
attributes.name: Oracle

attributes.content: And I must return to that same sole sarcophagus to extend my life, even if that means...
attributes.name: Oracle

attributes.content: I don't have much time left.
attributes.name: Oracle

attributes.content: No, I shouldn't call you by that anymore.
attributes.name: Oracle

attributes.content: It's a code name, an identifier for a mechanical creation. I should give you a true name.
attributes.name: Oracle

attributes.content: Calcite... birefringent crystals capable of refracting a single light source into two polarized lights. A beautiful phenomenon, like you.
attributes.name: Oracle

attributes.content: Calcite... Kal'tsit... that'll do. Do you like this name?
attributes.name: Oracle

attributes.content: (Expressing joy)
attributes.name: AMa-10

attributes.content: There are some things I won't have time to do. I hope you can finish them for me.
attributes.name: Oracle

attributes.content: Kal'tsit, I hope you can protect the life on this great land.
attributes.name: Oracle

attributes.content: New civilizations are always fragile, but harsh environments will show no mercy.
attributes.name: Oracle

attributes.content: It is arrogant to interfere with a civilization's development, but we don't have many chances left. This may be our last opportunity.
attributes.name: Oracle

attributes.content: Civilizations tend to repeat the same mistakes—sinking into violence, unverifiable thought pitfalls, and dead ends of self doubt...
attributes.name: Oracle

attributes.content: There's no escaping all of that, but just a tiny deviation is enough to wreck a whole civilization. The existence of civilization itself is already a sort of miracle...
attributes.name: Oracle

attributes.content: So, Kal'tsit, I hope you will guide them.
attributes.name: Oracle

attributes.content: Your gemini cycle grants you a practically infinite life. You can follow immature civilizations as they develop, and guide them onto a path forward with your knowledge.
attributes.name: Oracle

attributes.content: It's an arduous mission, but you might manage it, you should—
attributes.name: Oracle

attributes.content: A moment of silence.
The passionate speech comes to a halt. Oracle looks at the slender, delicate mechanical life, then gazes at the distant mountains half buried by sandstorms.
No...
attributes.name: Oracle

attributes.content: ...Forget what I just said, Kal'tsit. All of it.
attributes.name: Oracle

attributes.content: Go, Kal'tsit. Go look around you, then see what lies by the most distant of mountains. Go seek what forms existence takes.
attributes.name: Oracle

attributes.content: ...I must go back. Wake me up when you need to.
attributes.name: Oracle

attributes.content: Kal'tsit, I hope you'll... Or maybe I should say, the only mission I assign you now, is this:
attributes.name: Oracle

attributes.content: Find yourself.
attributes.name: Oracle

attributes.content: Search for traces of life. Search for hope and a future.
attributes.name: Oracle

attributes.content: Kal'tsit... Go find your own answer.
attributes.name: Oracle

attributes.text: Have you found the meaning of your life yet?

attributes.content: (Excited roar)
attributes.name: Mon3tr

attributes.content: Mon3tr appears by your side, but its stance is slightly different than usual.
Without a command from Kal'tsit, it zips towards the enemy, although a cluster of Originium rises from the ground, fully encasing the monster within.
You really have surprised me, AMa-10.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: You've broken free of my control at the price of severing your own gemini cycle system, even if this makes your life now utterly fragile.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: However, do you really intend to kill me via this method?
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: I knew from a long time ago your consciousness was already assimilated into the information within Originium.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Under these circumstances, it is impossible to truly kill you.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: But what Theresa and Theresis accomplished convinced me of something.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Your control over Originium is not absolute, and there still exist some methods to limit your authority over it.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: I did meet the two you speak of, within the Originium.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: Their efforts were indeed unexpected, and a pleasantly surprising struggle.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: But what of it? How are you so sure now that killing me here won't be a futile act?
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: When Mon3tr attacked you, you chose to defend yourself.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: How did you do it?
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: I see you have noticed.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Based on Theresa's research into Originium as well as the trap you set for Dr. {@nickname}, I added a few plans to your awakening room.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: As long as you wake up here, your consciousness will be trapped in this body, unable to return to Originium's sea of information.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Perhaps you will eventually manage to break through this restriction, and regain control over Originium, but right now you are merely human.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: To think you'd go this far to rebel against me—
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: Priestess, you are not Terra's creator. The life on this land has no obligation to bend to your will.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: ...This is my revenge on you, and my final act of resistance.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: You see the woman standing across from you reveal a hint of hesitation, but immediately after, Originium surrounds her.
...It's too late.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: (Agitated roaring)
attributes.name: Mon3tr

attributes.content: Dr. Kal'tsit... it's my turn to protect you now.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Black Arts crash and smash the Originium cluster, freeing Mon3tr as it quickly resumes its attack.
Originium crystals begin to grow again, but it's too late to form a barrier strong enough to resist Mon3tr's claws.
You see a nervous look on Priestess's face, a show of fear from the creator towards her creation.
As if Priestess finally recognizes the threat she is facing, the Originium on the entire deck responds to her consciousness and begins to rapidly grow.
Mon3tr has already closed in on its prey.
Five on the right confirmed paralyzed.
attributes.name: Mechanist

attributes.content: 'Perish.'
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: A bit scary at first, but in the end it just brought out enemies we've beaten before. Easy peasy.
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: Eat this now—
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: Am I just imagining it, or are our enemies spawning slower now?
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: This is PRTS's core system. The whole time it's been copying data of enemies we've faced in the past and pasting them here.
attributes.name: Raidian

attributes.content: But now it's reading the data so slowly, like something's hindering it...
attributes.name: Raidian

attributes.content: It seems like whatever the Doctor and the rest are doing is taking effect.
attributes.name: Raidian

attributes.content: Let's seize this chance and smash it.
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: We need to reach the Abyss's depths... there are people waiting for us.
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: Mon3tr, meltdown.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Black Arts and lasers take turns shooting at the gigantic and complex crystal cluster. The fierce assault even manages to suppress the Originium from spreading further.
Until the light of Arts swallow Priestess's figure.
Smoke and dust scatter, leaving only Originium fragments on the ground.
And a tattered white coat.
I can't feel... any signs of life, or any emotions...
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Maybe...
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Everything happens so suddenly you haven't had the time to regard the series of events as reality.
You saw that fearsome foe reduced to ashes right before your eyes.
Yet you feel no relief at all.
Are we quite finished playing yet?
How—
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Doctor, Amiya, fall back!
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: A powerful show of resistance, AMa-10. Your plan has proven effective.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: As you say, there is indeed a chance for you to kill me now...
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: But how does a single substitute made of Originium fluster you so?
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: AMa-10, I have no intention of debating the value of your beliefs.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: The principles you have always insisted on are so insignificant I can't even find a credible logical framework to assess their significance.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: It is not uncommon for experiments to turn out like this—small errors ultimately growing into huge obstacles. I have no choice but to accept this result.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: I'm very sorry, but I must treat you as an error, and wipe you out.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: Priestess raises her hand.
Originium begins to grow once more. Thorned crystal branches tightly envelop you and Amiya in a second, nearly swallowing you both.
Amiya tries her best to shatter the surrounding Originium with her Arts, but the crystal clusters only grow faster.
Doctor! Get behind me—
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Mon3tr—
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: It all happens in a flash of light.
You see the Originium crystal cluster near you explode. Amiya wanted to protect you, but time does not allow for her reaction.
You see the black monster rush over, blocking you both from the cluster with its large, solid body.
You see Kal'tsit...
What a pity.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: Doctor, do you ever doubt the meaning in your own existence? I do.
I understand my mission clearly. It is difficult, but I recognize its meaning.
As for the future, I believe you will find an answer. I can only persevere in that belief.
Don't spare too much worry for me. Rhodes Island shouldn't be so fragile that one person's departure would leave it unable to proceed on.
My hope?
It is to protect yours and Amiya's hopes.
Though our definitions of 'protect' have nothing in common, it's an oath I will never abandon. I will be standing here with you, until the very end.
We are unable to forget the past, but a different future may await you.
I have found the meaning of my life.
Please lead Rhodes Island...
And keep going.
{@nickname}.

attributes.text: Unconsciously, I seem to have grown accustomed to having someone at my side, guiding me.
Until now. I finally am sure of what I want to do.
No matter what happens, I will continue down this path. I will not abandon hope.

attributes.content: Dr. Kal'tsit—！
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: It all happens so quick, but you still manage to comprehend the cruel truth.
The foe you all face is incomprehensible by conventional means. She has authority over all Originium.
The bit of Originium on Kal'tsit's right shoulder is proof that she was born human, but also what steals her life away.
Originium crystals begin to spread as they swallow her entire body, only to shatter as the wind blows them away—your eyes fail to capture the entire process.
With strength, comes fragility.
A long life ends here.
She has kept her promise.
